intro: Cyrtandra fusca, commonly known as the Hawaiian red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. Cyrtandra fusca has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaii's flora.
